events.name: Thursday 23rd July
events.description: Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along!

events.name: Humla Workshop -  Advanced Application Security Testing with Burp Pro
events.description: We are pleased to inform our second humla workshop on Advanced Application Security Testing with Burp Pro by Sven. Please register ( required ) using below link for the workshop. As this event is hands-on, we can accommodate only few selected participants. If you get selected, you will receive a mail from humla champion by 20th July 2015. Register link: http://advancedburphumla.eventbrite.com Agenda: a) General Tips and Tricks b) Burp Collaborator explained in detail c) Creating and Handling of Macros / Session Handling Rules d) Tips and Tricks discovered during pentest engagements (e.g. circumvent transaction based CSRF tokens when using Active Scan of Burp) e) Using Burp Extensions (No development) Who should attend: Everybody that is interested in Penetration testing with Burp Suite Professional. The workshop will not explain Burp 101, therefore basic experience in Burp is highly recommended. What should I bring with me: Your own laptop, with latest version of Burp Suite Professional [masked] at the moment). If you only have Burp Suite Free Edition, not all exercises can be fully covered. Null humla champion: Sven Schleier is an Assistant Manager within KPMG Management Consulting (MC) Singapore and an experienced IT-Consultant in the field of Information Security, specialized in penetration testing of complex web applications. He is a Unix (and VIM) enthusiast since 1999 and was using Net|Free|Open-BSD heavily in his freelancer time back in Germany. When he is not at work he is spending time with his 2 year old daughter and cannot wait till she is old enough to build their first robot together and code some AI. Please reach out to humla champion at [masked] if you have any questions regarding the event.
events.location: Conference room “Blubox II” (20th floor), Hong Leon Building, 16 Raffles Quay, near Lau Pa Sat, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: iOS Dev Scout July Meetup
events.description: Venue: PlugIn@BLK71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-18, Singapore -[masked] Nearby MRT: One-north Speakers: 1st Session: Aizat Omar 2nd Session: Subh Agenda: 7:00 PM: 1st Session by Aizat on Core Image and Adding filters to your boring photos 7:45 PM: 2nd Session on what's new in watchOS by Subh I've attended every single WWDC sessions on watchOS this year, spoke to the Apple engineers at the labs and then attended a watch Hackathon where we created this app in few hours: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lKwhIC6Qv3E There are a lot of new APIs and features in the new watchOS. I will share more in detail how to build some of these things. 8:30PM: Show & Tell by members

events.name: DataLearn: Earth Hour + HOME DataDive Sharing
events.description: In late April, we held a DataDive where our volunteers spent a weekend to deliver data solutions for Earth Hour and HOME. This DataLearn event will include several of the participants of the DataDive sharing the methods and techniques they had used during the DataDive. The objective of the session is to get the overall community even better prepared for our next DataDive. It will be a relaxed overview from different people, and at the end we'll have a discussion on what you want to see in future DataLearn sessions. Date : 23 Jul (Thu) Time : Registration starts from 6.45pm (Event starts at 7pm) Special Thanks to our supporter PayPal Singapore for their generous food and venue sponsorship! Pizza will be served at the event. Format • 70 minutes sharing on Earth Hour • 70 minutes sharing on HOME • Questions are encouraged throughout the sharing sessions, and we'll end with a 15-20 minute discussion on what you want to see in future DataLearn sessions • No data will be shared; only sharing of methods and techniques Registration (ACTION NEEDED) Besides signing up on this meetup event, you are required to provide your particulars on this Google form for building security purposes. If we reach the event capacity, we'll be giving priority to people who were at the DataDive. See you there!
events.location: PayPal Singapore, 5 Temasek Boulevard, Level 9, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore 038985
